p: Presently, the highest concentration of IAPs is in the Adjara region in southwest Georgia, around Tbilisi area, and in central Georgia around Kutaisi (Figure S4). The distribution of IAPs is mostly associated with human activity around urban areas (Hulme, 2003). In particular, high soil disturbance and increased traffic around big agglomerations may have further facilitated plant invasions (Catford et al., 2012), as well as garden escapes from botanical gardens (Hulme, 2015). Our results also demonstrate that all IAPs have largely not yet reached all their potential distribution in Georgia and AHCV (see PRF and ARF values; Table 2), testifying for the recent and ongoing expansion of biological invasions in Georgia. The dispersal of these species should be limited by implementing conservation actions, particularly to limit their dispersal in AHCV.
